sense.name: a worried, unhappy mental state
sense.examples: The constant quarreling of his parents caused the child a lot of upset. Money problems were creating worry and upset for John.

sense.name: an unpleasant disruption of normal routine
sense.examples: The recent upset in the financial markets has rippled to other sectors of the economy. The labor strike caused an upset in the operations of the factory.

sense.name: medical ailment interfering with normal function
sense.examples: Mary complained of stomach upset after eating the cafeteria food. The patient saw his doctor after experiencing a week of lower GI tract upset. The disease is basically an upset of the body's insulin production.

sense.name: a metal-shaping tool
sense.examples: The blacksmith used an upset to forge the horseshoe.

sense.name: physically overturning an object
sense.examples: Bob's upset of the tea tray with his elbow sent cups and saucers flying to the floor. Please try to avoid an upset of those cans of open paint.

sense.name: an improbable or surprising victory
sense.examples: Their team beat the champions in an 11-inning upset last night. If John wins the election it will be quite an upset.
